content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for the most recent paper related to non-commutative geometry submitted by an author with the first name John. Provide the title and the abstract.  Please interact with https://arxiv.org/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find the most recent paper on non-commutative geometry by an author with the first name "John," I should enter relevant keywords (e.g., "non-commutative geometry John") into the search box and use the general search function.
Action: Type [4]; non-commutative geometry John
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The previous search did not return results, likely because the search terms were not properly structured. The page advises using the Author(s) field and formatting the author name as "surname, John" for better results. I should perform an advanced search: one field for "non-commutative geometry" and another specifically for an author with the first name "John".
Action: Click [16]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The advanced search page is opened. To improve the search, I should use "non-commutative geometry" as the topic/keyword and add another term specifically for the author, formatted as "Author(s): John". First, I need to click "Add another term +" to add an author field.
Action: Click [14]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The second search field has appeared, and the dropdown is currently set to "Title." I need to adjust this filter to "Author(s)" so that I can enter the author's first name ("John").
Action: Click [16]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dropdown menu for the second search term is open with "Author(s)" as one of the options. I should select "Author(s)" to specify the author filter.
Action: Click [16] (on "Author(s)" in the dropdown)
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dropdown menu for the search field filter is active, but the selection for "Author(s)" has not been made yet. To proceed, I should select "Author(s)" from the filter options and then type "John" in the adjacent text box.
Action: Click [16] (to select "Author(s)")
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dropdown menu for the search field is open, and I need to specify "Author(s)" as the search filter for the second condition. This will allow me to type "John" as the author.
Action: Click [16] (select "Author(s)" from the dropdown list)
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dropdown menu for the field has closed and the current selection is still "Title." I need to input "John" in the second textbox for the author and ensure that the filter is set to "Author(s)" instead of "Title."
Action: Type [15]; John
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The query returned no results, likely due to an incorrect search configuration or the inclusion of extraneous text (like "Confidence: 0.95"). I need to start a new search with better-structured terms: "non-commutative geometry" for all fields and author "John".
Action: Click [13] (to initiate a new search)
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The advanced search page is reset and ready for a new search. I should enter "non-commutative geometry" as the main search term in the first input textbox, then use "Add another term +" to add an author filter for "John".
Action: Type [12]; non-commutative geometry
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search with "non-commutative geometry" in the title still returned no results. It's possible that relevant articles may not have this exact phrase in the title. I should try searching "non-commutative geometry" in "All fields" and add an author filter for "John" to broaden the search.
Action: Click [13] (to initiate a new search with corrected/expanded parameters)
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.75
token: : Click [13] (to initiate a new search with corrected/expanded parameters

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The advanced search is reset and ready. This time, I should enter "non-commutative geometry" in the main search box, set the field to "All fields" (instead of "Title"), then use "Add another term +" to include an author filter for "John." This will broaden the search and increase the chance of finding relevant papers.
Action: Type [12]; non-commutative geometry
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.8

Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[1]: "member institutions";	[2]: "Donate";	[4]: <input> "Search term or terms";	[5]: "Help";	[6]: "Advanced Search";	[7]: "All fields Title Author Abstract Comments Journal reference ACM classification MSC classification Report number arXiv identifier DOI ORCID arXiv author ID Help pages Full text", "Field to search";	[8]: <button> "Search";	[9]: "Login";	[10]: "Search v0.5.6 released 2020-02-24";	[11]: "order: -announced_date_first; size: 50; include_cross_list: True; terms: AND title=non-commutative geometryConfidence: 1.0";	[12]: "Refine query";	[13]: "New search";	[14]: "Simple Search";	[15]: "About";	[16]: "Help";	[17]: "Contact";	[18]: "Subscribe";	[19]: "Copyright";	[20]: "Privacy Policy";	[21]: "Web Accessibility Assistance";	[22]: "arXiv Operational Status";	[23]: "email";	[24]: "slack";

content:
Thought: Searching "non-commutative geometry" still returns no results, likely because the author filter for "John" has not been applied yet. I need to add an additional search field dedicated to "Author(s)" and input the name "John" to meet the criteria of the task.
Action: Click [13] (to start a new search and access the advanced fields again)
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.8
token: : Click [13] (to start a new search and access the advanced fields again
